result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Defendant Samuel W Schafer in court with attorney M. Elizabeth Weathers.  Kevin Michael Osborne appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  The charges are dismissed and read into 15CT924.

Attorney M. Elizabeth Weathers in court.   Defendant Samuel W Schafer did not appear.   Kristi J Gordon appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Attorney appears by authorization.  Attorney Weathers requests the matter be set for plea and sentencing.  There is a fine only recommendation.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for February 29, 2016 at 10:30 am.

Defendant Samuel W Schafer in court with attorney M. Elizabeth Weathers.  Melissa Zilavy appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Weathers has not received a global pretrial offer.  The State is to provided an offer to Attorney Weathers.  Hearing scheduled for January 20, 2016 at 11:00 am.

ADDRESS INFO for Samuel W Schafer
Current: W1211 Woodview Drive Lot 171, Sullivan, WI 53178 United States  (Effective: 11-30-2015)
Prior: 700 E Main St # 119, Watertown, WI 53094
Authorization to appear received and filed.

Defendant Samuel W Schafer in court with attorney Sam Benedict for M. Elizabeth Weathers.  Ted S. Szczupakiewicz appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Benedict requests additional time to review discovery.  Hearing scheduled for January 5, 2016 at 08:30 am.
Notice of Hearing returned, for hearing scheduled on: 11/30/15 at 8:30 a.m.
Notice of Hearing returned, for hearing scheduled on: 11/6/15 at 9:30 a.m.

Defendant Samuel W Schafer in court.  Ted S. Szczupakiewicz appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  The defendant has not retained an attorney. The State does not have an offer.    The Defendant is ordered to apply at the public defender's office and return to Court.  The case is recalled.  The Defendant does qualify for representation and an attorney will be appointed for him.  Hearing scheduled for November 30, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Comply with all licensing restrictions, including IID. Defendant is not to operate a motor vehicle unless properly licensed.  Defendant to comply with I.D. Processing.

Defendant Samuel W Schafer in court.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court advises of right to an attorney.  NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED BY COURT.
  Hearing scheduled for November 6, 2015 at 09:30 am.
